description: Demolition of 4x existing garages to the rear and erection of single storey one bedroom dwelling.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Please confirm and update your proposed works.Please note that if the works that were approved has not been built, you would need to re apply for all of the works. Please amend the description and only include the proposed works and not any amendments to previously approved applications.

Please provide copies of existing and proposed elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing all elevations not just part and indicating all key dimensions for the proposed work.Please note that the submitted photographs do not scale correctly.
Please resubmit the site location plan showing a north point and outlining the whole site in red.

The fee required for your pre-planning application is £ 250.00.  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002. You may also pay online via the RBK website www.kingston.gov.uk
Please provide a copy of a site location plan

The development shall be completed in accordance with details and samples for all facing materials which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works above ground level are commenced. The development shall then be built in accordance with these approved samples and completed prior to occupation.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to occupation the following details shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and thereafter provided / installed in accordance with the approved details before occupation and thereafter be permanently retained.  refuse storage facilities in accordance with the requirements of the Residential Design SPD, 2013 (including their manufacturer's specification, dimensions, colour and texture).Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to above ground works, the following details shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and thereafter provided / installed in accordance with the approved details before occupation and thereafter be permanently retained: (a) boundary treatment, including walls, fences and gates (including their manufacturer's specification, dimensions, colour and texture). (b) landscaping and replacement plantingReason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to occupation details of secure cycle parking facilities for the occupants of the development hereby approved have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

All works on site shall take place in accordance with the following details which shall have previously been submitted to in the form of a Construction Management Plan and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of work: Statement on how the proposed development will be built, with method statements to outline how major elements of the works would be undertaken;Proposals for loading/unloading materials, site storage etc;The route to and away from site for muck away and vehicles with materials;Deliveries/collections to and from the site should use a route that is agreed with NRSWA team. The agreed route should be signed accordingly.   Protocol for managing deliveries to one vehicle at a time on sites with restricted access or space;Protocol for managing vehicles that need to wait for access to the site; andWhether any reversing manoeuvres are required onto or off the public highway into the site, and whether a banksman will be provided;Temporary site access;Signing system for works traffic; Site access warning signs will be required in adjacent roads.Whether it is anticipated that statutory undertaker connections will be required into the site.  Storage of plant, materials and operatives vehicles;Measures for the laying of dust, suppression of noise and abatement of other nuisance arising from development works;Location of all ancillary site buildings;Means of enclosure of the site; andWheel washing equipment.  The parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors.Reason: These details are required prior to commencement of development because the relevant works would take place at the beginning of the construction phase and in order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and to safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Within 3 months of first occupation, evidence must be submitted to the Council confirming that the development hereby permitted has achieved no less than the C02 reductions (ENE1), internal water usage (WAT1) standards equivalent to Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4.  Evidence requirements are detailed in the "Schedule of Evidence Required for Post Construction Stage from ENE1 and WAT1 of the Code for Sustainable Homes Guide.  Evidence to demonstrate a 19% reduction compared to 2013 Part L regulations and internal water usage rates of 105L/day must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise agreed in writing.Reason:  In order to ensure that all development is designed and built to make the most efficient use of resources, reduce its lifecycle impact on the environment and contributes to climate change mitigation and adaptation in accordance with Policy CS1 (Climate Change Mitigation) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The flat roof areas of the development hereby permitted shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, or any other form of amenity area whatsoever and shall be accessed only for maintenance or in the case of emergency.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No work on site (including site clearance) shall take place until a detailed design for the foundations together with a method statement for their construction has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development hereby approved shall only take place in accordance with the approved detailed scheme. Reason: In the interests of visual amenities and so that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation.  These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts.  A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

You have been granted planning permission to build a residential extension.  When undertaking demolition and/or building work, please be considerate to your neighbours and do not undertake work before 8am or after 6pm Monday to Friday, before 8am or after 1pm on a Saturday or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.  Furthermore, please ensure that all vehicles associated with the construction of the development hereby approved are properly washed and cleaned to prevent the passage of mud and dirt onto the adjoining highway. You are advised that the Council does have formal powers to control noise and nuisance under The Control of Pollution Act 1974, the Clean Air Acts and other relevant legislation.  For further information and advice, please contact - Environmental Health Department Pollution Section.

The Party Wall Act 1996 requires a building owner to notify, and obtain formal agreement from, any adjoining owner, where the building owner proposes to carry out work to an existing party wall; build on the boundary with a neighbouring property; in some circumstances, carry out groundworks within 6 metres of an adjoining building.

Unless clearly specified otherwise, the base of the development shown on the approved plans is taken to be external ground level, and not a Damp Proof Course or Internal Finished Floor Level. The external ground level is expected to remain consistent before and after construction of the approved development unless specified otherwise on the approved plans.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation.  These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts.  A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Reasonable efforts have been made to check that the plans submitted for the purposes of this planning application are consistent from one to the next, and that the development hereby approved can be implemented in accordance with all of the plans submitted. Should it transpire that this is not possible and that your plans are flawed, please be clear that it may be impossible to implement this permission, and that any development undertaken which relies on this permission may be unauthorised and subject to enforcement action if expedient.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown.Assessment:Repeat works mior in nature to maintain large trees in small garden setting. Trees to rear of property not affecting public amenity.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Last visit made just before lockdown began.Assessment:The works are acceptable and appropriate in trying to manage an extremely large specimen tree immiediate to the dwelling and endangering a children's play space.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out in person on 18/06/2020Assessment:The roots of T.2 have caused the low boundary wall fronting onto Palace Rd to buckle and crack and the only way to make the wall safe is to remove the tree.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out in person on 18/06/2020.Assessment:T.1 Is damaged at approximately 1.5m where the trunk has impacted upon the adjacent brick garden wall and the tree has grated away a chunk of the trunk at this point through rubbing on the wall and has attempted to heal with reactive growth unsuccesfully.  T.2 & T.3 are healthy young trees and can tolerate the works to reduce them so that they do not intefere with the overhead cables.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown.Assessment:The works to G.1 to manage the growth of these substantial trees is acceptable as standard maintenance.The works to G.2 likewise are acceptable as these affect a small group of trees on the boundary which are not very big and which will easily tolerate the works. Neither G.1 or G.2 works adeversely affect public amenity.Recommendation:No objections.
Inspection:Site inspection carried out in person on 18/06/2020Assessment:Minor works to prevent damage to property roof.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Tree viewed using google street view.Assessment:These repeat works are acceptable and minor in nature for genaral maintenance to retain tree in current poistion whilst preventing contact with bus shelter and encroachment onto public footpath.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out in person on 18/06/2020Assessment:The works to reduce T.2 & T.3 are appropriate and acceptable to maintin the trees in close proximity to multiple dwellings. The removal of T.1 whilst not desirable is understandable given the poor union at a low height meaning that the twin stems of the tree are inherently weaker and more susceptible to failure through wind loading. T.1 is not visible to the public and therefore it's removal is not presenting any particular loss to public amenity. This means it fails the main test of suitability for a TPO.Recommendation:No objections.
A1 - Loading
Regulation B1 means of escape in case of fire - Open plan arrangement removes lobbying to stair serving flats and is not acceptable
Your structural details and calculations are currently being assessed by our Engineer. This approval is conditional upon the provision of any further revisions that may be required. (A1)
Provide details of connection between T1-1 and the Post's. (A1)Provide details of galvanised shoe and connections at base of post ( P1-1 , P1-2). (A1)
Structural design calculations required for proposed roof structure
Structural calculations for roof structure and steelwork to be provided before work commences
Queries raised by RBK structural engineer are to be answered satisfactorily. (A1)
Condition of garden wall on site is to be assessed on site determine suitability for use (A1)
Glass areas located within 'critical locations' are to be of safe breakage as defined within approved document K. (K4)
